content: Today an inverted use-case came up. Where a patient has recorded information in their PHR, and given the Clinician access; WHEN the clinician notices a value that is clearly out of wack (e.g. looking at weight measurements and sees what must be the patients cat of 12 lbs), THEN the clinician might want to send a correction request to the patient in a way that the patient can understand specifically who/what/where/why the correction. --> I think this should NOT be pulled into scope, it is just a re-use in a different scope later when we have our solution.

I love this because it spotlights the value of collaboration, aka participatory medicine!

Are there things we could/should do now, in our design of PATIENT requested corrections, that would simplify the mirror-image workflow someday?
well @John Moehrke @Dave deBronkart thanks for hurting my brain. :) NIS1 (Not in Stage 1)
I would caution to not expand the scope... just keep this near.
